Title(s): ‘Charta Sancti Edwardi Regis de concessione ballivae suae’
Subjects: forests; charters; Edward the Confessor, saint
_description: ‘Charta Sancti Edwardi Regis de concessione ballivae suae’ — twenty-two lines

BLCottJulFX.First Lines:
Iche Edward Kinge haue yeouen of my forest the kepingeOf the
                    hundred of Chalmer & dansing to Randolf peperking…
BLCottJulFX.Last Lines:
…An Sweyn of Essex our brother and taken hym many ot…And
                    our steward Howelyn that besought me for hym
BLCottJulFX.Note:
Two verse lines per manuscript line. Some damage to
                    manuscript.
BLCottJulFX.Attributed Title:
Charta Sancti Edwardi Regis de concessione ballivae suae (f.
                    141)

HunEL34A9.First Lines:
Iche Edward Kingehaue geuen of my forest kepingeof the
                    hundrede of Chelmar & dansingeto Randolfe Peperking & to his
                    kindlinge…
HunEL34A9.Last Lines:
…and Swayne of Essex our brotherand taken hym many
                    otherand our Steward Hawlynthat besought me for hym
HunEL34A9.Note:
Late sixteenth-century copy; introduced by note, ‘In recepto in
                        Scaccario: In Carta Foresta Essex Rotulo Quinto’ (f.
                        77v); 22 lines, in two monorhyming quatrains and the rest mostly
                    couplets.
